body:
### Describe the bug

Hello, and thank you for the wonderful product that is Cython!

I don't have the time for a quality bug report, but I am unable to compile my library with cython 3.1 and had to pin cython>=3,<3.1 in order to get things working again. I believe this to be related to #4585 but that's just a guess from the traceback.

```
Building wheels for collected packages: ez_a_sync
  Building editable for ez_a_sync (pyproject.toml): started
  Building editable for ez_a_sync (pyproject.toml): finished with status 'error'
  error: subprocess-exited-with-error
  
  × Building editable for ez_a_sync (pyproject.toml) did not run successfully.
  │ exit code: 1
  ╰─> [134 lines of output]
      WARNING setuptools_scm.pyproject_reading toml section missing 'pyproject.toml does not contain a tool.setuptools_scm section'
      Traceback (most recent call last):
        File "/tmp/pip-build-env-0v_tsvoa/normal/lib/python3.13/site-packages/setuptools_scm/_integration/pyproject_reading.py", line 36, in read_pyproject
          section = defn.get("tool", {})[tool_name]
                    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^^^^^^^^^^^
      KeyError: 'setuptools_scm'
      /tmp/pip-build-env-0v_tsvoa/normal/lib/python3.13/site-packages/setuptools_scm/git.py:167: UserWarning: "/home/runner/work/ez-a-sync/ez-a-sync" is shallow and may cause errors
        warnings.warn(f'"{wd.path}" is shallow and may cause errors')
      running editable_wheel
      creating /tmp/pip-wheel-tl2d2oyn/.tmp-nfuq34[77](https://github.com/BobTheBuidler/ez-a-sync/actions/runs/15061921179/job/42338506206#step:4:78)/ez_a_sync.egg-info
      writing /tmp/pip-wheel-tl2d2oyn/.tmp-nfuq3477/ez_a_sync.egg-info/PKG-INFO
      writing dependency_links to /tmp/pip-wheel-tl2d2oyn/.tmp-nfuq3477/ez_a_sync.egg-info/dependency_links.txt
      writing requirements to /tmp/pip-wheel-tl2d2oyn/.tmp-nfuq3477/ez_a_sync.egg-info/requires.txt
      writing top-level names to /tmp/pip-wheel-tl2d2oyn/.tmp-nfuq3477/ez_a_sync.egg-info/top_level.txt
      writing manifest file '/tmp/pip-wheel-tl2d2oyn/.tmp-nfuq3477/ez_a_sync.egg-info/SOURCES.txt'
      reading manifest template 'MANIFEST.in'
      adding license file 'LICENSE.txt'
      writing manifest file '/tmp/pip-wheel-tl2d2oyn/.tmp-nfuq3477/ez_a_sync.egg-info/SOURCES.txt'
      creating '/tmp/pip-wheel-tl2d2oyn/.tmp-nfuq3477/ez_a_sync-0.0.1.dev1.dist-info'
      creating /tmp/pip-wheel-tl2d2oyn/.tmp-nfuq3477/ez_a_sync-0.0.1.dev1.dist-info/WHEEL
      a_sync/asyncio/gather.c: In function ‘__pyx_gb_6a_sync_7asyncio_6gather_16generator5’:
      a_sync/asyncio/gather.c:2318:68: error: ‘__pyx_CoroutineObject’ has no member named ‘__pyx_pymonitoring_state’
       2318 |       PyMonitoringState* __pyx_pymonitoring_state = __pyx_generator->__pyx_pymonitoring_state;\
            |                                                                    ^~
      a_sync/asyncio/gather.c:5725:3: note: in expansion of macro ‘__Pyx_TraceDeclarationsGen’
       5725 |   __Pyx_TraceDeclarationsGen
            |   ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
      a_sync/asyncio/gather.c:2319:[81](https://github.com/BobTheBuidler/ez-a-sync/actions/runs/15061921179/job/42338506206#step:4:82): error: ‘__pyx_CoroutineObject’ has no member named ‘__pyx_pymonitoring_version’
       2319 |       __pyx_monitoring_version_type __pyx_pymonitoring_version = __pyx_generator->__pyx_pymonitoring_version;\
            |                                                                                 ^~
      a_sync/asyncio/gather.c:5725:3: note: in expansion of macro ‘__Pyx_TraceDeclarationsGen’
       5725 |   __Pyx_TraceDeclarationsGen
            |   ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
      error: command '/usr/bin/gcc' failed with exit code 1
      [end of output]
  
  note: This error originates from a subprocess, and is likely not a problem with pip.
  ERROR: Failed building editable for ez_a_sync
Failed to build ez_a_sync
ERROR: Failed to build installable wheels for some pyproject.toml based projects (ez_a_sync)
Error: Process completed with exit code 1.
```

Hope this helps!

### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

I do not have a minimal reproducible example to share, but the source code that led to this error is [here](https://github.com/BobTheBuidler/ez-a-sync/blob/2d9fc1563f84575526852a967338c360cb6b677f/a_sync/asyncio/gather.pyx) if anyone wants to take a look

### Expected behaviour

For my library to compile and run like it does on 3.0.x

### OS

ubuntu, macos, windows

### Python version

3.13

### Cython version

3.1

### Additional context

_No response_
title: [BUG] Unable to compile my library on python3.13 with cython3.1
